titleStmt.title: Joseph B. Hardwick et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8635

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excelency Jas F Robinson
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

The undersigned Petitioners Beg leave to Represent to youre Excelency that at the Sept Term 1858 of the Powell Circuit Court that the Commonwealth of Ky obtained a Judgement against James H. Muncey for Twenty dollars for unlawful gaming

and we would further Represent to your Excellencey that Said Muncey is now in the Service of the United States and has been ever since August 1861 and has Left a Family dependent upon him for Suport and in view of his Service to his Country we would Respectfuly Beg of youre Excelencey to Remit Said fines

Jan 24th 1863
Jos B Hardwick J P C C
J L Hereld. C. P. C
M Steward
Johnson ,A. Dawson D, S, T, C
Thos C Judy Clerk P. C. C.

Powell Cir. Ct
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
$20. } Gaming
James F Muncey
Issd Feby 3d 1863
